article1.title: How to Master Cashew Nut Auctions on e-Anacarde
article1.description: Follow our step-by-step guide to understand the auction process, set your reserves, and maximize your income on Benin's leading cashew auction platform.
article1.author: Aïssatou Adégbidi

article2.title: New Government Standards for Cashew Production
article2.description: The Beninese government has issued new guidelines to improve the quality and traceability of cashew nuts. Discover the requirements and how to comply.
article2.author: Kofi Mensah

hero.heading: Online Cashew Nut Auctions
hero.description: Participate in real-time auctions for cashew nuts and their derivatives in Benin. Monitor every bid, outbid, and support local producers with confidence.
hero.image_alt: e-Anacarde logo, cashew nut auction platform

faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1_answer: e-Anacarde is an online auction platform dedicated to cashew nuts in Benin, directly connecting producers and buyers to maximize transparency and transaction value.
faq.q2_question: How can I register as a producer?
faq.q2_answer_part1: To register, fill out the form with your production information and upload the required documents for verification.
faq.q3_question: How to participate in an auction?
faq.q3_answer: After your account is validated, log in, go to the auction page, select the desired cashew nut lot, and place your bid indicating the amount you are willing to pay.
faq.q4_answer: e-Anacarde applies a 2% commission on the final amount of each won auction, with no hidden fees for producers or buyers.
faq.q5_question: How are payment and delivery handled?
faq.q5_answer: Once the auction is won, payment is made via our mobile payment partners (MoMo, Flooz) or bank transfer. Delivery is organized by approved carriers, at the buyer's expense or according to the agreement.
faq.q6_question: What quality standards must I meet?
faq.q6_answer: You must comply with the new Beninese government guidelines on cashew nut calibration, moisture content, and packaging. Check our article 'New government standards for cashew production' for all details.
